alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:15PM EST until December 20 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Penobscot and Piscataquis Counties. Piscataquis River Above Dover-Foxcroft affecting Piscataquis County. Penobscot River At West Enfield affecting Penobscot County. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Penobscot River...including Mattawamkeag, Grindstone, West Enfield, Eddington, Bangor...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River at Medford. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs along the Medford Road between Alder Brook to Robin Hollow Drive. Minor flooding along the lowland areas from Trestle Road Bridge downstream to Maxfield townline. Minor flooding along River Road and North Howland Road to I-95 Bridge in Maxfield to Howland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 6.3 feet. - At 12.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 13.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 12/22/1973. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 515 AM EST.
